item.name: Dauntless Battlepaint
item.text:
This small jar of battle paint can be used to enhance even the most cowardly warrior. This jar contains 4 charges of battlepaint. If you spend 10 minutes applying this battle paint to a creature, they gain +1 AC, immunity to the frightened condition, and 1d6 temporary hit points for the next hour. The item regains 1d4 charges every day at dawn. If the last charge is used, roll a d20. On a 1, the item is destroyed.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 37 (Third Party)

item.name: Keening Shortblade
item.text:
This +1 sword scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. If a critical hit is scored, roll all of your damage dice an additional time. Creatures damaged by this blade cannot regain hit points until the start of your next turn. When you attack an object with this sword, you do the maximum amount of damage.
Curse: This weapon thirsts for blood, and will not leave your hand until it has slain a creature.
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Light: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.
Proficiency: martial, shortsword Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 37 (Third Party)

item.name: Helm of the Skald
item.text:
This drinking horn fills with delicious mead at every sundown. A creature who drinks the mead gains a bonus to Intelligence (History), Charisma (Persuasion), and Charisma (Deception) checks for the next 12 hours equal to its Constitution modifier. Additionally, increase the number of Bardic Inspiration die you have by 2.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 37 (Third Party)

item.name: Svalinn Shademaker
item.text:
This large +1 round shield protects its user from the sun. While attuned to it, you have resistance to fire and radiant damage. While wielding this shield, you are immune to the negative effects of sunlight sensitivity.
Proficiency: shield Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 37 (Third Party)
